Transcript

International news sparks heated discussion. The United States once again imposes chip sanctions on China, completely banning the export of high-end chips. Meanwhile, a massive meteor shower, a once- ina century event appeared in the skies above the Great Sea Kingdom tonight. These news reports have once again plunged the chip technology sector of the Great Sea Kingdom into crisis. However, in the great Sia Kingdom at the National University of Defense Technology in dormatory 2011 for male students, the US is imposing these sanctions again.

Fatty Wong angrily handed the news tablet to Lynn. Old Lynn, with your abilities, why are you choosing to work on chips instead of going to the Weapons and Equipment Research Institute? Fatty Wong chuckled. The man insisted, "As long as I can contribute to the country's scientific and technological progress, it doesn't matter where I go." He walked to the balcony where the light of a meteor shower streaked across the night sky. I trade my roommates's 50 years of single life for the great Sia kingdom to break through its chip blockade. The instant he made his wish, an invisible beam of light shot toward his head.

A mechanical voice echoed in my mind. A suitable host has been found. The seed for the inheritance of the ninth level Chinese civilization in the universe has been successfully bound. What's going on? Lynchin was taken aback. The inheritance seed is bound and cannot be removed.

Level 9 seeds of Chinese civilization inheritance. What are these? The seeds of Chinese civilization inheritance aimed to rapidly cultivate outstanding citizens. The inheritance seed comes with its own inheritance space which the host can enter to learn more. Lynchin immediately realized that this was the legendary golden finger. He decided to go back to his dorm and learn more about it later.

When Fatty Wong saw him return, he asked in confusion, "Old Lynn, weren't you going to see the meteor shower? I finished reading." Lynchin climbed into bed. I'll rest first. Keep your voice down. He closed his eyes and silently recited, "Enter the inheritance space." In an instant, Lynchin's consciousness was pulled into a vast and boundless space. The space was so huge, he looked around in awe.

The main purpose of the inheritance space is to allow the host to inherit the technology of civilizations from level one to level 9. Currently, he can only access technologies of civilizations below level one, while Earth's technology level is only level 0.8. Only one technology can be selected for inheritance at a time, and each technology needs to be designed, manufactured, and certified in the laboratory of the inheritance space. Amazing, Lynn Chun exclaimed, his heart filled with anticipation. If these technologies could be successfully passed down and handed over to the nation, the great Sia Kingdom would rapidly take off.

Lynchin became even more resolute in his previous choice. Please select the first option, technological inheritance, complete quantum chip technology, complete technology for super solid state magnetic field batteries, complete technology for high energy laser weapons, complete technology for electromagnetic rail guns. Lynchin did not hesitate and chose the complete quantum chip technology. The great Sea Kingdom has long been subject to the control of others in the field of chips and AI computing power chips are particularly important. A vast amount of information flooded Lin Shen's mind from basic theories to complex designs and then to lithography machine production technology.

Two hours later, he mastered quantum chip technology. Lynn Shan was shocked. Compared to quantum chips, siliconbased chips were simply insignificant. With quantum chips, great sia will definitely be able to overtake others. Eagle just wait for the counter sanctions.

A determined light shown in Lin Chen's eyes. Next, the practical part. Manufacturing a quantum lithography machine and designing a quantum chip. Lynn Shun, full of confidence, began working busily in the laboratory. Outside, he entered a deep sleep and his body was undergoing changes.

The next day in dormatory 211, sunlight streamed onto Lin Chens bed. Fatty Wong glanced at the bed opposite him. Why is old Lynn up later than me? Fatty Wong walked over and nudged Lin Shan with his elbow. Old Lynn, get up or there won't be any breakfast left. Lynch still didn't respond.

The fat man's heart tightened. He reached out and touched Lynch's nose to confirm he was still breathing. He wondered if Lynchin had been hit on the head by a meteor shower and hurriedly took out his phone to call 120. Suddenly, Lynchin opened his eyes wide. Don't hit me.

The fat man was startled. You scared me to death. Lynchin sat up and stretched. I'm in deep sleep. Understand? Deep sleep? Sleeping for 12 hours.

The fat man didn't believe him. Lynchin coughed once. All right, leave me alone. After washing up, Lynchin sat down at the computer and suddenly felt his mind was exceptionally clear. Could it be a change brought about by the inheritance of the seed? Lynchin was delighted.

He began to write feasibility study of quantum lithography technology as his graduation project. Fatty Wong leaned over for a look. Old Lynn, did you get hit by a meteor last night? Are you working on your graduation project with a quantum lithography machine? Quantum lithography machine? The fat man scoffed. That's just a concept. No country can actually build one, Lynn Chun explained earnestly.

The US is blocking our chip technology. They have too many silicon-based chip patents, so quantum chips are the easiest to implement. The fat man nodded. All right, Lynn. I look forward to your results.

Lynchin was focused on writing and did not respond. For the next 10 days, Lynchin wrote proposals during the day and worked in the inheritance space to build a lithography machine at night. In the space of inheritance, he repeatedly optimized and started over. Finally, on the ninth night, Lynch completed the design of the quantum lithography machine and successfully verified it. Finally finished, Lynchin breathed a sigh of relief.

Thanks to the optimization of the inheritance space, a lot of time could be saved in reality. The next day, Lynchin began a final check of the quantum lithography machine feasibility study. He reviewed the document repeatedly to ensure there were no problems. Lynchin breathed a sigh of relief and sent an email to his mentor. Meanwhile, in the faculty apartment of the National University of Defense Technology, Lynchin's adviser, Luod, sat in front of his computer looking at a pile of unsatisfactory graduation projects until he saw the email from Lynch.

Lynch, why is he getting involved in all this fancy stuff? Rody frowned. He knew Lyn Shan was an excellent student, but quantum lithography machines were not something a student could make. Why did this kid take such a shady path? Rody thought with some disappointment. So he opened the email. Rody opened the email.

From the first page, the surprise on his face quickly turned into shock. This is incredible. It's actually possible. From the theoretical design of the quantum lithography machine to the detailed parameters of each component, the content is exceptionally detailed and supported by ample data.

How did Lynchin do that? Even the National University of Defense Technology doesn't have the facilities to conduct experiments like that. The man in the suit picked up the computer, affixed a seal, and handed over an agreement. This is a confidentiality agreement. Please sign it. Rody was shocked when he saw the word top secret on the cover. He had never signed a confidentiality agreement of this level before.

He quickly signed the papers and the security personnel took away the computer and the confidentiality agreement. Rody returned to his room and sent Lynn Chin a short message. Lynch clenched his fist excitedly.

The notification sound from the inheritance space rang out. Congratulations host on completing the quantum chip manufacturing and unlocking the next technological inheritance. Please choose freely. Lynchin did not rush to choose the next technology but continued to test the performance of the quantum chip he designed. After a series of tests, the results surprised him greatly.

The performance of this one nanometer quantum chip is 100 times that of the most advanced chips on the market such as the Apple and Apple chips. Even under highintensity usage, the heat generation is only 1% completely solving the problems of heat generation and battery life. Excellent. Lynch was full of confidence in his design. Once it goes into mass production, it will definitely break through the US blockade.

As soon as he finished speaking, technical data on the super solid state magnetic field battery flooded his mind. Lynch enclosed his eyes to process it and the ingenuity of the technology left him in awe. The parameters of the super solid state battery greatly surprised him.

Its volume is onetenth that of current batteries on the market, but it can achieve a range of 5,000 km with just 5 minutes of charging. Even more impressive is the battery stability in harsh environments. It can function normally even at -7Â° C. With this technology, the new energy industry of great sea will directly lead the world, Lynchin thought excitedly, and the problem of energy imports can also be solved. Next, he began hands-on practice in the laboratory of the inherent space.

The manufacturing process of super solidstate batteries is much simpler than that of quantum chips. 10%, 20%, 30%, 100%. Self test complete. Machine is functioning normally and is preparing to enter working mode. As these words appeared, a cheer erupted, and the laboratory erupted in jubilation. Great, we did it.

The progress bar slowly advanced, then suddenly stopped at 90%. Lie Jian Guo asked anxiously, and Lynchin immediately began the repair. It's all right. Continue. Finally, the progress bar reached 100%.

The lithography machine's finished product port opened and 1 nanometer quantum chips were successfully produced. Success. Cheers erupted in the lab and Lin Chun breathed a sigh of relief. Thank you, Lynn. Li Jang Wo said deeply moved.

Next up is the performance test. The data instantly displayed. Chip manufacturing process one nanometer. CPU performance 102 times that of the latest GTX CPU. GPU rendering 110 times that of Apple's flagship chip.

Heat generation 1/100th, that of traditional chips. Yield rate 99%. Everyone gasped, marveling at the chip's astonishing performance. Fantastic. We've retaliated against the sanctions this time.

Finally, we have our own high-end chip, Linshan said with a smile. This is just the beginning. Subsequent trial production batches were very stable, preparing for the exhibition. The next day, the Shanghai Global Semiconductor Exhibition opened. Click. The moment the box was opened, everyone held their breath. Inside the transparent container laid dozens of faintly glowing chips, each smaller than a fingernail, exuding an air of mystery. "This is a quantum chip. Have you really achieved a one nanometer quantum chip?" Domestic audiences were thrilled while foreign media and executives continued to mock and ridicule.

Yamamoto Ichiro, a senior executive at Doning Electronics, laughed and said, "The counterfeiting level of the great Sia Kingdom has improved again. If it's true, I'll eat while standing on my head." Lie Jian Guo calmly responded. This is our independently developed one nanometer quantum chip. He listed the chips parameters one by one. Chip manufacturing process 1 nanometer.

GPU rendering 110 times higher than Apple's. CPU performance 102 times higher than Gaongs. Heat generation 1/100 of traditional chips. Yield 99%. Each parameter elicited gasps of surprise from the audience.

The cheers from the crowd were deafening. Incredible. We've actually made a one nanometer quantum chip. Let the Americans die. This time it's our turn to retaliate.

These words were exhilarating. All the previous grievances and anger were transformed into excited shouts. Foreign media immediately raised questions. Impossible. How could a one nanometer quantum chip be achieved? You don't even have a quantum lithography machine.

Domestic audiences were excited while foreign journalists frantically snapped photos. The executive at Gaoong stared at the screen, unable to believe what he was seeing. Ultimately, Yamamoto was taken away by employees of Dong Jing Electronics.

Lie Jian Guo looked outside and said, "Let's wait a little longer and show our chips to the people of our country." The experts nodded in agreement.

They were filled with pride. All of this is for national rejuvenation to give the country confidence on the world stage. At the same time, executives from domestic semiconductor companies also gathered around. Academicianly, this is Jeang from SMIC. I'm looking for cooperation.

Can we do contract manufacturing? Mr. Lee, we at Chong Yen can fully cooperate. We at Huah Hong are also willing to cooperate. These manufacturers are all eager to seek cooperation. The one nanometer quantum chip developed by the Syako Institute presents both opportunities and threats.

If they seize the opportunity, their company will take off. If they are outmaneuvered, they will be eliminated. The market is ruthless. He explained that the problem was that the energy frequency did not match the atmospheric refractive index. The water droplets were simply refracting the laser, not blocking it.

Academician Luke couldn't believe it. We've already calculated the refractive index. How could it be wrong? Lynshin smiled and continued explaining, writing down the formula to explain the change in refractive index caused by temperature changes. If we take temperature changes into account, this variable can overcome the obstacle of rainy and foggy weather. The laboratory fell silent.

Suddenly, academician Lu excitedly slapped his thigh. That's it. How come I didn't think of that? The other engineers also suddenly realized what had happened and apologized to Linshan, saying, "We misunderstood you." Lynshin smiled and waved his hand. No need to be so polite. I only know a little about it myself.

This would put the Great Sa Kingdom in a passive position. Moreover, there have always been international conventions. Attack satellites or space stations in near Earth space during peace time. Otherwise, it will face sanctions and condemnation from all countries. Although there is a convention, but over the years, the US has launched countless satellites into near-Earth space.

After their lifespan expires, they all become space debris. Furthermore, the US often secretly uses near dead satellites to collide with the normal satellites of China and Russia. They even attempted to crash into the space station of the Great Sea Kingdom. This isn't the first time the US has done something like this. However, none of this has been made public.

Now, Lynn Shun intends to use this method to collect interest from the United States. Prepare to continue testing. Target, a defunct satellite in near Earth space. Power set to 100%. Start charging.

2 seconds later, charging complete. Lynch waved his hand and shouted, "Fire!" A dazzling laser beam suddenly shot out from the transmitter like a sharp blade slicing through the darkness of near-ear space. It hurdled straight toward the abandoned satellite. Wherever the laser passed, the air seemed to ignite, radiating a scorching heat. The atmosphere was penetrated instantly.

At the testing site, everyone was intently watching the monitor screen. Sudden, the moment the laser hit, the surface of the abandoned satellite lit up with a blinding light. Immediately afterwards, the satellite disappeared. Although sound cannot travel in a vacuum, but the intense light from the explosion and the immediate disappearance of the satellite both demonstrate the terrifying power of superpowered lasers. Just when everyone thought it was a perfect ending, they discovered that the laser beam in the footage did not disappear after destroying the abandoned satellite.

Starlink satellites in different orbits on the same straight line. Upon seeing this, academician Louu immediately sensed something was wrong. This is bad. But it was too late to stop it. In the blink of an eye, after three flashes of light, the three Starlink satellites of the United States were vaporized and disappeared into space.

The silent space has returned to its former tranquility. It's as if it never existed. This is it's all over. This is a huge problem. The three Starlink satellites belonging to the United States.

Chapter 26. Eagle. Where are my satellites? On the monitor screen. David, a staff member at the monitoring center, was leisurely drinking coffee, wearing headphones, and humming a tune. He glanced at the monitor screen out of the corner of his eye.

Similar products from the US have a lifespan of 2,000 hours.

Single crystal blade processing precision is substandard with a yield rate of only 30% far below international standards. This anti-gravity plasma engine, it uses a brand new type of alloy material which is lightweight, has high hardness, and is resistant to high temperatures. The wind blew, but the light blade remained completely still without even the slightest tremor. This scene, this left Commander Wong and his men completely stunned.

It really is a lightsaber. Commander Wongs eyes were filled with disbelief. Holy crap. Is this science fiction coming to life? Battalion Commander Lee subconsciously took a half step back. Company Commander Xiao was so shocked that he stood there motionless like a fool.

Moreover, all indicators are more than 100 times higher than the most advanced aerospace materials currently available internationally, far ahead of other countries. Anyone who manufactures aircraft engines knows this. The main core materials for Arrow engines are divided into five parts.

First, there's the turbine blades and turbine disc. Almost all of them use nickelbased single crystal alloys. Maximum temperature resistance 1,300Â° C. Tinsel strength 1,00 to,200 MPa. This is currently the most advanced material on Earth.

There are also ceramic matrix composite materials used in the combustion chamber and turbine shroud rings. Its maximum temperature resistance is only 1,650Â° C, and its tensil strength is only 300 to 400 MPa. Even the highest temperature resistant tailpipe and the afterburner use carbon carbon composite materials. Its maximum temperature resistance is only 2,600Â° C. Needless to say, its tinsel strength is only 200 to 300 MPa.

The compressor blades used later are made of titanium aluminum alloy which can withstand high temperatures of 900Â° C. The outer bypass casing uses a resin-based composite material that can withstand high temperatures of 300Â° C. Lynshin's new alloy has a maximum temperature resistance of 300,000Â° C. It is 130 times more heatresistant than the highest temperature resistant carbon carbon composite material. Crucially, it weighs only 1% of the lightest material resin based composite materials.

Its tensil strength is 100 times that of the highest resin based composite material which has a tensil strength of 2,000 MPa. It reached a terrifying 200,000 MPa. Crucially, it can maintain its performance without degradation or deformationation even at high temperatures. This shows just how terrifying the parameters of this new alloy are. With it the mechanical components of an aircraft engine, all needs can be met using just this one material.

Only this kind of material exists. Only then can the terrifying high temperatures generated by the instantaneous electrolysis of air in a plasma engine be met. Lynchin picked up an alloy sample. Otapu, come out and explain. Can our aircraft carrier withstand laser cannons? In the comment section, the voices of concern drowned out the previous arrogance.

They were influenced by science fiction movies from a young age. There is a sense of awe and fear towards groundbreaking weapons. Seeing how powerful the laser weapons of the Great Sea Kingdom are, the American public has begun to worry. Have they fallen too far behind? Will the Great Sea Kingdom settle scores with us later? In contrast, consider the network of the Great Sea Kingdom. They were completely engrossed in the realry.

Top 10 trending topics on Weibo. Nine of them are related to the disappearance of the broken warship. Huh? We finally blew up that damn warship. After holding back for so many years, it's so satisfying. The Filipino fisherman dared to provoke us before.

Okay. Lynch nodded. Then let's begin the test. Measure the thrust first. Objective: simulate 50 tons of thrust.

What? Li Jian Guo was utterly shocked. Shaolin, you're going to measure 50 tons of thrust directly. The other engineers were also shocked. Right off the bat, they immediately tested the 50 ton load capacity. Anyone who owns an aircraft engine knows this.

The US's most advanced XN 100 engine. The maximum thrust is only 220 knots or about 22 tons. That immediately doubled the amount. Is this defying the heavens? Lynn Shan smiled confidently. This is just the beginning.

You'll see after the tests are done. All right. Lie Jian Guo calmed his excited emotions. As per Chief Engineer Lynn's instructions, let's begin the test. The engineers immediately took action.

After setting the simulated thrust, press the engine start button. The indicator lights on the engine casing lit up one by one, emitting a slight hum. The entire engine startup process was unusually quiet. Yet, it also contains a sense of power that is about to be unleashed as all the indicator lights turned green. Thrust simulation initiated.

3 2 1 begin. As the countdown ended, almost at the same instant, the entire laboratory seemed to be shaken by a tremendous force. Everyone could feel the ground beneath their feet trembling slightly. Thrust data is being uploaded. Real-time monitoring in progress.

The thrust data on the screen started to fluctuate. 100 knots, 500 knots, 1,000 knots. It suddenly surged to 2,000 knots. Then it stabilized completely. Why not promote? Because it has already reached the limit of the testing equipment.

See the data displayed on the screen. Liian Guo and the engineers were all stunned and dumbfounded. The most advanced engine in the United States only has a thrust of 220 knots. The current power plasma engine has already reached a terrifying 2,000 knots in initial tests. And that's not even the limit.

Terrifying. Li Jian Guo was staring at the data when he suddenly snapped out of his days and hurriedly called for a stop. Stop it. The thrust has exceeded the instruments testing range and the instrument cannot withstand it. The engineers snapped out of his days.

The engine was quickly shut off. The surrounding engineers instantly erupted in excitement. My god, 10 times the thrust in the first test. This is terrifying. Won't our fighter jets be able to cruise at supersonic speeds at will in the future? This is still the limit of our testing equipment, not the limit of the engine.

All the engineers were deeply shocked by the test data of 2,000 knots. The key point is that this engine only weighs 1 ton. This shows just how terrifying his final thrust to weight ratio is. Whether it's a large aircraft or a fighter jet, they can easily break through the supersonic flight barrier. Lie Jian Guo came to Linshins side and said with a sigh.

Shaolin, it seems that our testing equipment can no longer meet the needs of this engine. Lynch nodded, "It's all right. We can just install it and test it later. Next, let's continue testing the lifespan. Goal: To achieve 10,000 hours of continuous simulated operation." Okay.

Lie Jian Guo didn't question it this time. The simulated lifespan test has begun. Time pass second by second. The running time on the screen keeps increasing. 100 hours.

500 hours. 1,000 hours. 5,000 hours. 10,000 hours. The engine's parameters remain stable, showing no signs of degradation.

Looking at the data, Liang Guo was so excited that his eyes welled up with tears. 10,000 hours and zero degradation. The USF135 service life is only 2,000 hours. Our machine has already run 10,000 hours and it's still as good as new. If this is the absolute limit, it's estimated to be 50 times theirs.

The engineers around were so excited that they had tears in their eyes. Lynchin walked over and patted Lee Gian Guo on the shoulder. Oldly this isn't over yet. Initiating anti-gravity mode moment. All the engineers were filled with anticipation once again.

This is the most important part. Anti-gravity. Who can break through this technology? They will all become the eighth wonder of the world. The engineer pressed another button. A pale blue light suddenly appeared at the bottom of the engine.

The entire engine slowly rose into the air. It hangs 1 meter above the ground, completely still. Looking at the floating engine, Lie Giani Guo suddenly burst into tears. It's done. It really is done.

We now have our own advanced engines. I'll never have to put up with other people's attitudes again. The surrounding engineers also applauded. Some people even jumped up in excitement. After the initial excitement, holding the final data, Lie Jian Guo said to Lynn Chun, "Shaolin, you have done another great service for our great Sia.

They quickly typed commands into the console and the data on the screen began to fluctuate wildly. The engine's hum changed slightly but remained stable. Lynchin stood aside quietly observing the various indicators. He wanted more than just functionality. He wanted absolute reliability.

After all, this engine is the heart of his next project, the aerospace fighter. There can't be any problems. At the same time, Lie Jian Guo returned to his office. He took a red cell phone out of the drawer. "Calm down your excited emotions.

After thinking about the wording of my report, only then did I slowly dial that familiar number. Beep beep beep." The phone rang for a long time. Just when Lie Jian Guo thought the leader was busy, the call was connected. "Hello." A dignified yet gentle voice rang out. Lie Jian Guo quickly spoke up.

"Hey, boss, I have some great news to report. The first test of the anti-gravity plasma engine was a success. There was a two-c silence on the other end of the phone. Then came a steady but slightly excited voice. Okay, okay, okay.

How is the performance? Without hesitation, Lie Jiano reported all the parameters and data. The above data is only preliminary test data. The words had barely left his mouth. On the other end of the phone was silent for a few seconds. A moment later, the great leader's unquestionable voice rang out. Very good, Comrade Jenua. I order you to mobilize the entire nation to support Comrade Lynch's research and development efforts.

Any technology he proposes should be given priority in resource allocation. Furthermore, we will award Lynchin an honorary military rank and we will absolutely not allow comrade Lynch to suffer the slightest injustice. Finally, tell comrade Lynchin that the country will always be his support. Let him do whatever he wants. Moment.

Li Jian Guo held the phone, his eyes instantly reening. He lived almost his entire life. This is the first time I've seen the country attach so much importance to a young person. He hung up the phone. Lie Jian Guo leaned back in his chair, unable to calm down for a long time.

He murmured to himself, "Kobayashi, now you can focus on your research. He knows. With Lynchin around, the time when the great Sia Kingdom stands at the pinnacle of blue star will be infinitely shortened." A moment later, Li Jian Guo calmed himself down. Then I went straight to the laboratory. He wanted to tell Lynn Chin the good news.

Laboratory. Lynchin was looking at the test poems at the back. Looking up, he saw Li Jango walk and looking excited and asked curiously. Oldly, you finished your report so quickly. Lie Jang Guoo walked quickly to him and pulled him into a small cubicle in the laboratory.

Shaolin, the leader highly praised you after hearing the report. Furthermore, the leadership has ordered that all research and development efforts be supported by the entire nation. All other benefits will be provided to you at the highest possible level. The leader said that we absolutely cannot let you suffer any injustice. Lynn Shun was deeply moved after hearing this.

I never expected the country to attach so much importance to it. At that moment, he knew that the choice he had made earlier was the right one. With the full support of the country, the technology for future inheritance spaces can be realized in reality very soon. After this period of time, Lynshin discovered that his physical fitness was still improving. Although it has not been systematically tested, but he felt that his physical fitness was even better than that of those elite soldiers.

Even in brain development, it surpasses Einstein. These are all benefits that the seed of inheritance has brought him. It's like passing on a skill after another. He himself can also achieve corresponding improvement and evolution. This remarkable change made him even more convinced of the path he was on.

He clenched his fists tightly, his tone filled with unprecedented determination. Don't worry, Mr. Lee. I guarantee that the anti-gravity plasma engine will be mass-produced within 1 month. Within 6 months, the aerospace fighter jet will achieve mass production.

Lie Giano patted him on the shoulder. Good, good. Go for it. I'll do my best to allocate resources for you. Then, Lynchin went back to the lab to oversee the testing.

Otep looked at the intelligence report. His eyes were full of disdain. He also knew that the naval strength of the great sea kingdom had improved rapidly in recent years. Although it seems unbelievable, but the returning fisherman told the story in great detail. Many people were skeptical, it has been decided to refrain from fishing outside the designated area for the time being inside the presidential palace. As Little Mars looked at the latest intelligence, his face was terribly gloomy. Intelligence indicates that all 10 warships were destroyed with no survivors. "Fuck, fuck." He violently tore the report up.

The secretary stood beside him, bowing his head and whispering, "Mr. President, people are saying, saying that there is a deity protecting the South China Sea of the Great Sia Kingdom." "Gods, little Mars," sneered, but his eyes were filled with fear. "Those are laser cannons. They're the weapons of the Great Sia Kingdom." He suddenly remembered something and looked up abruptly. "Give the order immediately.

All fishermen, all boats. Anyone who dares to approach the waters of the great Sa Kingdom will be arrested on the spot. Also, notify the border to increase vigilance. The secretary nodded quickly and turned to leave. Wait.

Little Mars called out to him again, his voice trembling. Contact the US again and asked them if they're going to do anything about it. The secretary responded and left. Little Moss slumped in his chair, looking out the window at the national flag. The flag fluttered in the wind as if mocking his incompetence.

How could the great Sia Kingdom suddenly become so strong? Why? He muttered to himself, his eyes filled with despair. Two days later, International Military Tribunal. The hall was full of people. The American representative slammed his fist on the table, spitting as he spoke. The Great Sa Kingdom abused its power, destroying the warships of the Sakura Kingdom and the Philippines.

This is a violation of international military law. Compensation is required. An apology is required. The representative from the Sakura Kingdom echoed sharply. All 15 of our warships have sunk.

Thousands of soldiers have perished. The great SA kingdom must take responsibility. The representative from the Philippines also stood up, his face flushed red. Our warships have also been destroyed and our fishermen have been frightened. The Great Sea Kingdom demands an explanation.

All eyes of the representatives from various countries were focused on the representative of the Great Sea Kingdom. The representative of the great SA kingdom slowly rose to his feet and declared doineeringly, "First of all, the warships of Japan and the Philippines illegally entered our territorial waters. Our country will eliminate all invading enemies in accordance with laws and regulations. I also want to ask you, by sending warships into our territorial waters, are you trying to wage war without declaring war?" The American representative didn't dare to respond and quickly change the subject. We are in international waters and you have no right to interfere.

Huh? Pisces. The representative of the great Sia Kingdom sneered, taking out a document and slamming it on the table. This is a UN recognized map of maritime boundaries. If you don't acknowledge it, our warships can also patrol near your country another day. You, the American representative, was trembling with anger, but dared not respond directly.

if he dares to deny it. They don't have laser weapons as advanced as those of the Great Sa Kingdom. The warships of the Great Sea Kingdom might actually sail into their territorial waters. At that point, will they expel them or not? Therefore, the US representative can only keep quiet. The representative from Japan tried to argue, "We were just conducting joint military exercises and had no intention of intruding into your territorial waters." Unintentional.

the representative from Great Sea Kingdoms eyes turned cold. You call it unintentional after spending a dozen minutes in our territorial waters. Or perhaps our warships might also consider taking a stroll in your territorial waters tomorrow. I, the representative from the Sakura country, did not dare to respond. The hall was completely silent.

The representative of the great Sia Kingdom surveyed the entire room, his voice firm. Our country respects international law, but will never allow any country to infringe upon our sovereignty. We don't provoke trouble, but we're not afraid of trouble either. After saying that, he turned around and sat down. The hawk representative opened his mouth, but couldn't utter a single word.

In this debate, the great Sia kingdom emerged victorious. Representatives from other countries applauded, and the applause echoed like a tide in the hall. Many national representatives who had initially adopted a wait and see attitude chose to stand with the great Sia kingdom. They have come to a deep understanding of the power of the great SA kingdom. If you don't take sides now, when will you? The representatives from the United States and Japan turned grim upon seeing this.

This is the last thing they wanted to see. But now they can't find an excuse to make things difficult for the great Sia Kingdom. In the end, he could only leave early in anger and humiliation. Seeing this, the applause became even more enthusiastic. With this, the South China Sea naval exercise incident has come to an end.

Siaki Yuan in Li Jang Wos office. Wong Hao, the leader of the sixth generation fighter jet project team, pleaded. Dean, the new engine has passed testing. When can our sixth generation fighter jet project be restarted? Restart the project? Lie Jian Guo frowned and shook his head. Not for now.

Shaolin said there's a seventh generation fighter jet project. What? Wonggha was taken aback, then realized, "Dean, we already have a foundation in the sixth generation fighter jet. As long as we work a little harder, we'll see results soon. Seventh generation fighters are too far off. We urgently need sixth generation fighters to make a difference." Lie Jian Guo sighed.

Don't worry about this. Let me talk to Shiaolin about it first. He picked up the phone and dialed Lynch's number. in Lynchens office. He had just finished compiling the technical data for the seventh generation aerospace fighter.

His phone rang and seeing it was Lie Jian Guo, he answered it oldly. What is it? Xialin. The sixth generation fighter jet project team wants to restart the project. What do you think? Lynch paused for a moment, then laughed. Rebooting the sixth generation machine? No need.

I have already compiled the technical data for the seventh generation aerospace fighter. Its performance far surpasses that of sixth generation fighters. Lynch nodded. We can hold a technical demonstration meeting tomorrow so that everyone can see it. After hanging up the phone, Lynchin looked at the data on his computer. On the cover, the six characters bitey aerospace fighter gleamed with a cold light. This is the name he came up with for the seventh generation fighter jet.

The white emperor symbolizes the sky of the great Sia kingdom which will be protected by him. Chapter 66. You call a speed of Mach 20 fighter jet. Siaki Yuan Dean's office. As soon as Lie Jian Guo hung up the phone, he turned around and met Wong Hoa's anxious eyes.

Don't worry, you'll see when the time comes.

Wonggho frowned, his expression filled with helplessness. Looking at the sixth generation fighter jet design drawings in his hand, he felt a mix of emotions. The team has worked hard for 5 years and the engine has just passed testing. They are about to see results. It was suddenly paused.

Now a seventh generation fighter jet has appeared and it wants to skip the sixth generation altogether. But Dean, we already have a foundation in sixth generation fighter jets. Quantum lithography machines, superpowered laser cannons, anti-gravity engines.

Wonggho had already decided in his mind what to do if the seventh generation fighter jet did not meet expectations after tomorrow's meeting. The next day at 9:00, conference room of the Xiaku Academy, Wong Hao was stunned when he walked in and was met with a room full of people.

Academician Jang from the aerospace field, academician Lu, a leading figure in material science, Dr. Zhao, a radar expert. They are all prominent figures in the industry. Academician Jang with his gray hair, sat in the front row leaning on a cane. He saw Wong Hao and waved.

Shiao Wong, you've come at the perfect time. I heard chief designer Lynn is going to develop a seventh generation fighter jet. Is that plausible? Wong Hao shook his head with a rice smile. Mr. Jang, I'm not sure either.

Just then, the meeting room door was pushed open. Li Jang Guoo dressed in a smart Jong Sean suit walked in with great spirit. Lynshin followed behind wearing a white t-shirt and faded jeans. Lie Jian Guo stepped onto the podium and began to speak. Everyone, thank you for making this trip.

Today's meeting is classified as top secret. Please sign the agreement first. The staff distributed the agreements to everyone. The young experts attending this level of meeting for the first time trembled when they saw the words top secret. This This is the highest level of confidentiality.

I heard that this was only signed when we were working on nuclear weapons. Some people couldn't help but mutter to themselves, their eyes filled with shock. Those who had previously attended Linshins technical discussion sessions instantly had their eyes light up. He turned on the projector and the six bold characters by aerospace fighter instantly appeared on the screen. Ladies and gentlemen, today I will introduce the technical parameters of the bitey space fighter. Lynch picked up the laser pointer and tapped the screen. When the first line of parameters appeared, the entire room fell silent instantly. Maximum payload 20 tons.

Max speed 20 Mach. Cruising speed 15 Mach. Equipped with an anti-gravity plasma engine and a super solid magnetic field battery, it has a range of 40,000 km. Wonggho suddenly stood up filled with shock. Mach 20 40,000 km range.

How How is this possible? Academician Jangs eyes widened in disbelief. Shiao Wong is right at Mach 20. How do we solve the overload problem? What materials did you use? How did you address the safety concerns of the pilots? Lynchin smiled and continued to explain. In terms of materials, we use the same materials as the anti-gravity plasma engine. All parameters are fully capable of withstanding the high frictional temperatures of Mach 20.

He paused, then continued explaining. There's absolutely no need to worry about overload. The cockpit is specially designed to prevent injury to the pilot during sudden acceleration of the fighter jet. Professor Louu was utterly shocked after hearing this. This this design can actually achieve anti-gravity.

If this can really be achieved, it will put us at least 50 years ahead of the world. Other experts and missions were so shocked by these parameters that they were speechless. Achieving even one of these is already incredibly impressive. Achieving all of that is simply beyond the reach of current technology. However, the parameters and data that Lynch released made them feel very real.

It's like data obtained through every test. Lynshin ignored their shock and continued speaking. The avionic system adopts a fully intelligent design which can automatically avoid all enemy attacks and can also achieve autopilot. The airborne 3D visual radar has a detection range of 5,000 km and can lock onto 2,000 targets simultaneously. In terms of weapon systems, it is equipped with two super powerful laser cannons with a range of 1,500 km.

The stealth coating utilizes the latest super stealth materials, enabling radar stealth, infrared stealth, visual stealth, and thermal imaging stealth. The words had barely left his mouth. The entire conference room was eerily quiet. The experts and missions gaped, their mouths agape as if they could fit an egg in them, and it took them a long time to come to their senses. The meeting room erupted instantly.

A fully intelligent avionics system. A 5,000 km detection range. 2,000 lock targets. A superpowered laser cannon with a range of 1,500 km. A super stealth coating.

This isn't a fighter jet. It's practically a mobile aerial fortress. Academician Jangs fingers trembled slightly as he looked at the parameters on the screen. He had lived to be over 70 years old and had never seen such an outrageous fighter jet. A speed of Mach 20.

You call this thing a fighter jet? This is clearly a weapon capable of going to heaven and earth. The surrounding experts echoed their agreement. This is outrageous. This technology is simply not what we should have now. If this could really happen, no one would dare to venture into our skies again.

The air force of the great Sia Kingdom is about to rise completely. The doubt on everyone's faces turned into shock and their eyes were filled with excitement. Lynchin smiled as he looked at everyone's reactions. Please rest assured everyone. These parameters are all achievable.

Wong Hao gasped utterly convinced. Looking at the diagram of the white emperor fighter jet on the screen, all his inner turmoil disappeared. Chief engineer Lynn, I'm impressed. After the applause subsided, Lynchin slowly began to speak. Ladies and gentlemen, the White Emperor fighter jet can not only operate within the atmosphere. Break through the atmosphere. Entering space. Is this a move to dominate near Earth space? Chapter 67. Goal: Near Earth Space Overlord. The meeting room was deathly silent.

Deanly, you're still laughing. The US is clearly targeting us this time. How can I not be anxious? At this moment, he had lost all the authority he once held as an Air Force commander. One day before New Year's Day, conference room of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology building of the Great Sa Kingdom.

Earth's resources are simply insufficient for space exploration. Everything needs to be prepared in advance. Most importantly, the resources on the moon are all unclaimed. They can mine however they want. There's no need to pay attention to the ecological environment.

Minister Chun was completely dumbfounded after hearing this. Chief Engineer Len, are you sure we can really build a lunar base? It's not that he doesn't believe it. It's too sci-fi. Lynch nodded emphatically. Minister Chun was stunned for two seconds, then overjoyed, he slapped his thighs hard with both hands, making a crisp cracking sound. Great. That's wonderful. Chief Engineer Lynn, you've really surprised us.

At the same time, we will have the Ministry of Foreign Affairs lodge a formal protest with the Great Sia Kingdom to express our dissatisfaction with their behavior. Yes.

Everyone responded in unison and then got to work. Soon, the US Ministry of Foreign Affairs lodged a strong protest with the Chinese embassy in the United States. We demand an explanation from the Great Sia Kingdom. The Great Sia Kingdom s embassy in the United States. Ambassador Sier received a formal protest document from the US Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

His brows furrowed slightly. It seems the US's attempt to stir up trouble in the desert has failed. Although he doesn't know the specifics yet, but it will definitely affect the interests of the United States. Then the matter was reported to the headquarters of the Great Sea Kingdom. The news quickly reached the military headquarters of the Great Sea Kingdom.

The military headquarters held a meeting. Haha, our laser air defense weapons are performing exceptionally well in desert regions. The American fighter jet was shot down instantly. We have just received many orders from desert regions, exceeding 200 billion. The generals were filled with excitement.

All the generals were full of expectations for the bite aerospace fighter. Chapter 83.

The great sia kingdom. The enemy may go and so may I. Siakiuan in Li Jangos office. He looked at the message sent by the military. His face was wrinkled but his eyes were full of excitement.

200 billion. Orders from desert regions have increased by another 200 billion. I never expected that even a downgraded version of the laser cannon could easily shoot down an American fighter jet. Haha. Lie Jian Guo became happier and happier as he thought about it and he burst out laughing.

Indians offer assistance. NASA headquarters conference room. The conference room was filled with the core scientists of the Starship project as well as Musk. Durret sat in the main seat, his face stern. The president just gave me the order.

The maiden flight of the Starship should be brought forward as soon as possible. A billion dollars in bonuses a day early. If this goes wrong, everyone's fired. Musk was wearing a gray hoodie. His hair was messy and his fingers kept rubbing the coffee cup.

The Starship ceiling valves haven't been fully tested yet, and the inventory of key components is only enough for one test flight. If it's done earlier, the risk will double," an elderly scientist wearing glasses pushed up his glasses and said in a deep voice, "Chief, we haven't even finished the most basic stress test. The valve had leaked three times during previous flight simulations.

Moving things forward now is gambling with lives. Another blonde scientist chimed in. Yes. Moreover, the precision requirements for titanium alloy parts are extremely high and our own factories simply cannot produce them all. We used to have everything processed in the great sea kingdom.

But now, he hadn't finished speaking. The conference room fell into a deathly silence. Everyone knows that given the current relationship between the US and China, it's impossible for the US to import components from China. Durret stared at them, his expression growing increasingly grim. If the Great Sa Kingdom doesn't work, well find someone else.

They're not the only ones capable of doing this on Earth. But his tone also suggested a lack of confidence. If other countries can process it, they wouldn't have needed to import from the Great Sea Kingdom back then. Most importantly, the components are manufactured in the Great Sea Kingdom, which are of high quality and inexpensive. Moreover, they use only the finest materials and never cut corners.

Just then, a man wearing an orange shirt stood up. He is a scientist who immigrated from India and his name is Kira. Kira suggested with a smile, "Director, how about we try getting India to help with the processing? From what I understand, India's processing technology is also very advanced. My relatives back home also specialize in producing precision parts, and the prices are half the price of those in the great Sia Kingdom." The moment those words were spoken, the conference room erupted in chaos. An elderly scientist suddenly stood up glaring angrily and said, "Kira, are you crazy? The processing technology of India? They can't even make ordinary steel parts up to standard.

The bracket we had them make last time deformed before we even installed it." The blonde scientists scoffed. Using parts manufactured in India, our starship might as well declare a failure. Other scientists stepped forward to refute this. This shows just how bad India's reputation is. Seeing this, Kira's face instantly turned red and he forced himself to explain.

It's different. This time it's different. My cousin's factory has introduced new equipment that specializes in making titanium alloys. I guarantee the accuracy will be perfect. Durret looked at the arguing crowd with a gloomy expression.

He turned to look at Musk and asked in a deep voice, "Musk, say something." Musk sighed, leaned back in his chair, and looked tired. Currently, there is no better option. The Great Sea Kingdom's path is not viable. Other countries either lack the technology or the production capacity. Even if the risks are high, we can only give it a try.

India. His voice was soft. Yet, it sounded like a stone thrown into water. The old scientist wanted to argue but was interrupted by a look from Durit. It settled then.

Kira, contact your cousin's factory and order a batch of ceiling valves immediately. There's only one requirement. Delivery must be made within 5 days. Hero was so excited he almost jumped up and nodded quickly. Okay, I'll make the call right now.

He took out his phone, stroed out of the meeting room, and muttered to himself. This time, well show you the true strength of India. Durret watched his retreating figure, then glanced at Musk, his brow furrowed, "Muskavi, do you really think they can do it?" Musk shook his head, picked up his coffee cup, took a sip, and said with a rice smile, "I don't know, but now we have no choice but to gamble. I'm betting that India will be reliable this time." The scientists in the conference room all had their heads down and no one spoke. They all knew in their hearts that the odds of winning this bet were extremely slim.

The outskirts of Mumbai, India, in a dilapidated little workshop. The roar of the machines was deafening and the ground was littered with scrap metal and oil. The workshop owner was a bearded man named Sanjay. He held an order in his hand and said speechlessly, "Titanium alloy ceiling valve and it has to meet NASA standards." What should we do?" Sunj sneered and patted the worker on the shoulder. No titanium alloy? Can't you just use aluminum alloy? If you paint it with titanium alloy color, who can tell? Go wrong? By the time they find out, our money will already be in our hands. At that point, who will care whether their starships explode? He picked up a paintbrush, dipped it in silver paint, and started brushing it onto the aluminum alloy valve. Sanjay hummed a little tune as he brushed. It's so easy to make money off the US. You can get tens of thousands of dollars just by doing a little shoddy work.

The cold electronic notification echoed in the cockpit. The smiles on the three faces vanished instantly. Tom's expression changed drastically, and he hurriedly checked the data. What's going on? Why did a helium leak occur? Lucy's hands flew across the control panel. Energy output is unstable.

The leak is getting faster and faster. He has flown into space so many times. This is the first time something like this has happened. Previously, the most common problem was engine failure. There has never been a problem with the valves.

Lucy's eyes reened. Energy output is only 30%. We're going to lose control. She panicked completely. I originally thought this mission would go very smoothly.

Chapter 87. The Starship exploded. A giant firework worth billions in the global live broadcast room. The screen was instantly flooded with comments from nizens in the great sea kingdom. Here it comes.

While Lin Chun and the others were talking, in the live stream footage, the Starship is on the verge of collapse. Inside the Starship's cockpit, Tom's forehead veins bulged.

The valves are made of aluminum alloy. Muscovie, you've ruined us. He had just finished yelling. The starship was shaking more and more violently, and the numbers on the instrument panel were flashing red. The sky outside the window began to spin, and the orange red engine flames flickered on and off.

Sudden, a blinding white light exploded in the air. Boom! Boom! Boom! A huge explosion resounded throughout the entire airspace. The Starship exploded in midair. An orange red fireball burst open high in the sky like a deformed firework. Fragments scattered and sparks flew everywhere.

Some burned to ashes before they even hit the ground. The original Starship was instantly turned into a burning pile of scrap metal. Ground launch center. Optin stood frozen in place. His eyes were wide open like saucers, and he repeated, "It's blown up, my starship.

It's blown up. He never dreamed of this. The first test flight of the starship will end in this way. Even if it flies out of Earth, it will disintegrate in space. They can also find excuses to cover it up, but it exploded right after takeoff.

Just how many more cuttingedge technologies is the great SIA kingdom hiding? Optin slammed his fist on the table and roared, enough. Now is not the time to talk about these things. We must find a way to deal with this. If we allow the great SA kingdom to continue like this, we will lose our hegemonic position. Silence felt over the meeting room.

After a long silence, Pete spoke up. Mr. President, perhaps we can unite with other countries to impose sanctions on the great sea kingdom. Optton sneered. sanctions.

Do you think any country would dare to join us in sanctioning the great Sia Kingdom? Japan is a prime example. Who wants to follow in their footsteps? Then what do we do? Pete asked, frowning. Opton took a deep breath and forced himself to calm down. Convene an emergency global summit immediately. Notify all allies that we must devise a countermeasure.

The Great Sa Kingdom must not be allowed to continue leading. Let's all pull our scientific research resources and strive to catch up with the great sea kingdom in terms of weaponry and equipment. At the same time, a man lunar landing must be carried out before the great sea kingdom. Regarding this proposal, no one in the meeting room had any objections. This is also the best solution at present unless they are willing to bow down to the great SA kingdom, but they can't do it.

Of cherry blossoms, the chaos has reached its peak. In major cities, supermarket glass doors were smashed by crowds. Shelves were overturned and instant noodles and bottled water were scattered all over the ground. Someone was carrying a few bottles of water when they were pushed to the ground by the people behind them. But he struggled to his feet and lunged to grab the bread again, his face contorted with rage.

Lynchin slid his fingertips across the keyboard, bringing up detailed data. First, there are the dimensions. The Kimping space plane is 95 m long with a wingspan of 75 m, a height of 25 m, an empty weight of 75 tons, and a maximum payload of over 500 tons. What a load capacity of 500 tons. Li Jian Guo was completely dumbfounded.

This is not a space plane. It's clearly a space transport spacecraft. the world's largest transport aircraft, the N225, has a payload capacity of only 250 tons, but he can only fly inside Earth. Even Musk's supposedly invincible Starship only has a maximum payload of 300 tons, and it's a one-time use vessel. Even if recycling is considered, the load capacity is only 100 to 150 tons.

The Kuong space plane, however, is designed to fly to the moon and return. It can actually carry a load of 500 tons. Terrifying. Sial, are you sure you didn't add an extra zero? Definitely not. Those parameters are terrifying.

Lie Jian Guo was deeply shocked by the number. Lin Shun continued, "The Kuaning space plane uses three newly enhanced anti-gravity plasma engines. Its speed inside Earth can reach Mach 20, and after leaving near Earth orbit, its maximum speed can reach Mach 60. It's possible to make a round trip from the moon to Earth in a single day. After listening, Li Jian Guo fell silent.

Shaolin, are you sure it's not Mach 6? Li Jang Guoo asked timidly. He Lynchan chuckled. It's Mach 60. It seems I really am getting old. Lie Jian Guo sighed inexplicably.

He had to accept that he was getting old. Lynshins design concepts are increasingly exceeding his comprehension. The body aerospace fighter jet is barely acceptable. The Kuaning space plane has completely overturned his understanding. with a load capacity of 500 tons and a speed of Mach 60.

Inheritance begins. The mechanical sound faded away. Countless data streams flooded into Lin Chen's mind. Controlled nuclear fusion simulating the fusion reaction inside the sun. Dutyium and tridium were confined in a vacuum chamber using a superconducting magnetic confinement device.

The temperature is 150 million degrees C which is three times higher than the core of the sun. Under high pressure, atomic nuclei overcome repulsion and collide to form helium nuclei releasing enormous energy in the process. Safer than nuclear fishision with virtually zero contamination. The energy from 1 gram of dutyium tridium fusion is equivalent to 8 tons of gasoline. This is the real energy revolution.

Lynch looked at the various data, his eyes filled with excitement. With controlled nuclear fusion technology, the energy problem for the lunar base has finally been solved. Next, I will introduce the technical implementation plant. According to the design, controlled nuclear fusion uses a superconducting magnetic confinement device. It uses a new type of tungsten steel alloy for the vacuum chamber which can withstand a temperature of 200 million degrees C. The fuel uses dutyium and tridium. 1 g of it releases the same amount of energy as 8 tons of gasoline.

The moment the words were spoken, the experts from other places erupted in uproar. What a material that can withstand 200 millionÂ° C? Lines of precise data scroll by.

The meeting room fell silent instantly. The initial doubts vanished immediately. The experts couldn't help but stand up and walk in front of the big screen. His eyes were fixed on the parameters on the screen. This this data, it's so realistic.

Has the experiment already been conducted? In all their years of research, they had never seen such perfect experimental data. The previous doubts were instantly overturned. As the explanation went deeper, Lynchin started by discussing material formulations and then moved on to energy output models. Then there's the design of the ignition device. Experts performed Sichuan opera face-changing life.

Its total area reaches 4.9 million km, which is a quarter the size of the moon's surface. It reaches a depth of 13 km deeper than the Mariana Trench, the deepest point on Earth. 50,000. The engineer was completely dumbfounded. This won't there be any profit? Lynshan, profit is not the focus as long as safety is guaranteed. What is the great SIA Kingdom planning now? He turned to the technical director beside him and asked, "Tell me, has the Great Sea Kingdom really developed a flying car?" The CTO frowned deeply. "It's hard to say.

Previously, all major car manufacturers in the Great Sea Kingdom chose to shut down all traditional automobile businesses. Who knows? They might actually develop it." If we consider the technological level of the former Great Sea Kingdom, he would state outright that it was impossible. But things are different now. The technology of the great SEA kingdom has seen an explosive increase. They can even travel to and from the moon with ease.

It's not impossible to delegate technology. After hearing the explanation, Phelps face darkened. If it's true, then the entire automotive industry is going to be transformed. Let's prepare in advance. The technical director nodded, his heart filled with mixed feelings.

He can only pray now that flying cars in the great Sea Kingdom are very expensive. It cannot be popularized among the general public. Only in this way can these car companies still have a way to survive. On the other side, European automakers also held an emergency online meeting. In the conference room, the heads of each car company looked extremely grim.

Jaguar Land Rover in the Sunset Country reminded him. Have you forgotten about the mobile phone industry a few months ago? When it comes to the mobile phone industry, the entire meeting fell silent.

A cleaner raw material for controlled nuclear fusion than dutyium and tridium. It is also more stable. If helium 3 had been used as the fusion material, the unstable energy output would not have occurred because helium 3 does not produce high energy neutrons during fusion. This unique characteristic can fundamentally solve the problem of nuclear radiation from waste. Moreover, it is even easier to convert into electrical energy.

Even the waste generated is completely pollutionfree. It is cleaner than solar power and wind power. Li Jang Wos expression was serious. Shaolin, you're right. We still need to develop lunar resources as soon as possible.

That's great. It really works. Dad, you can continue to enjoy your family time. Beside him, his wife, her eyes red rimmed, gently patted his shoulder. Wagua.

Dad will get better. Chunua nodded emphatically, then stared intently at the screen, unwilling to look away for even a second. On the other side, a mother holding her child watched her husband's brow gradually relax on the screen and suddenly burst into tears. The child was startled and started sobbing. She quickly hugged the child, wiping away her tears and smiling.

"Baby, don't be afraid. Daddy's almost better. Daddy will be home with us soon." There's hope for Dad. Honey, just wait a little longer. We'll be reunited soon. Honey, hang in there a little longer. Mom will go buy you your favorite strawberries right away.

Chapter 148. The Guanghan Palace. Project established. Siaki Yuan. Li Jang Wos office.

The second phase involves laying helium, three refining pipelines, and constructing related mining farms for refining. Lie Jang Wos eyes were full of excitement. Passers by stopped and began to get excited and excited. Is a man moon landing finally coming? I hope it's a success. Without India interfering this time, we will definitely succeed. European countries have gathered together for joint research and development. It's bound to succeed.

That's right. Our Eagle Alliance is one entity. People in those countries knew that it was impossible for them to land a man on the moon alone. They wanted to use this method to align themselves with the US. This was to achieve the goal of restraining the great sea kingdom.

In other countries on Earth were completely different. I suggest preparing a speech in advance about the technical malfunction to avoid being caught off guard. I bet this time it will be postponed on the grounds of excessive radiation in space. Do you believe it? No. Optin will definitely say it's because of the inferior fuel used.

3 days after the announcement of the US manned lunar landing materials laboratory of the Siaku Institute. A super 3D architectural printer, its entire body gleaming with a futuristic metallic sheen stands tall on the laboratory testing platform. Chief engineer Lynn. This is the super 3D building printer built according to the design plan. Academician Zhao introduced the topic with great excitement.

The engineers around him were filled with pride. It has only been a few days since the project was launched. The key equipment for the construction of the Guanhan Palace Base, the super 3D building printer completed the design. It can directly use lunar soil as raw material, add a newly developed high strength polymer, and directly create super strong buildings that can withstand a category 18 typhoon in a magnitude 10 earthquake. Lynshan looked at the super 3D building printer in front of him and nodded in satisfaction.

Great job. You've all worked hard. Chief Engineer Lynn, we didn't work hard at all. Academicianha quickly waved his hand. Without Chief Engineer Lynn's technical solutions and guidance, we simply couldn't have developed such advanced cuttingedge technology products.

The surrounding engineers nodded in agreement. Lynn Shun waved his hand, changing the subject. All right, let's stop flattering each other. Let's start testing the performance of this super 3D architectural printer. Okay, chief engineer Lynn.

Academician Joe nodded. Let's begin the simulation test now. He turned to the relevant engineer and gave the instructions. Initiate the first level stress test. First simulating the printing of the outer wall module of the lunar base.

Receive. The engineer responded enthusiastically. Then start adding raw materials and add a certain proportion of high strength polymerizing agent. After confirming that everything is correct, press the start button. The printer nozzle sprayed out silver gray ink.

It solidified instantly into a dense plate. Detect module density. report density 280g/ cm superscript 3 compressive strength over 8,000 MPa more than 100 times that of the strongest concrete. All test parameters have been reported. Cheers erupted throughout the laboratory.

Outrageous. This intensity is beyond belief. Even a magnitude 10 earthquake or a category 18 typhoon would have no effect on it. It can even withstand the bombardment of mushroom bombs. Yes, it will definitely be the best building material when used in infrastructure projects across the country.

This strength far surpasses that of any building material on Earth. A lunar base built with it would be absolutely super safe. Even if someone tries to sabotage the bombing, it won't have any impact. Chief engineer Lynn, we succeeded. Academicianha was so excited that he was trembling.

He is a national level academician in the field of building materials. He has an excellent understanding of all building materials. He knew that this material would be invaluable once it was used in the construction of a lunar base. There will be absolutely no problem with the strength of the lunar base.

It can even be widely promoted in the great sea kingdom. This is especially true for coastal cities and cities near earthquake zones. It frequently suffers from natural disasters such as typhoons and earthquakes. If you use a super 3D building printer to build a house, the losses caused by natural disasters will be reduced indefinitely. It has immeasurable benefits for both the people and the country.

5 hours later, a complete scaledown model of the lunar base stands in the center of the test site. The silver gray exterior has a metallic sheen, giving it a futuristic look. The nozzles moved across the lunar surface and the silver gray walls extended upwards at a visible speed. Report. The first exterior wall is complete. 3 m high, 1 m thick. Start printing the support columns.

There is no atmosphere on the moon and the sunlight shines directly on the building modules, giving them a cold, sharp glow. Quick, eliminate him. Before he could finish speaking, another gunshot rang out.

However, the infected person who was shot did not fall down. Instead, he let out a roar and rushed towards the guard who fired the shot at a speed far beyond that of an ordinary person. The guards were terrified at the sight and cried out, "Oh no! Run!" The monster that even bullets can't kill is beyond their ability to deal with. Unfortunately, it was too late. Another guard who had been bitten also began to mutate and joined the bloody hunt.

Moments later, all 20 guards were transformed into bloodthirsty biommonsters. They left the base and wandered aimlessly in the surrounding area. Any creature they encounter along the way will not escape their clutches. The originally docel animals fell one after another under their attack and then mutated into new monsters. As time went on, the ranks of biommonsters continued to grow.

Some of the monsters have even approached the nearest village and launched attacks on the villagers. Baka monster run. The villagers fled in terror, but they were no match for the monsters. Ultimately, none of the hundreds of residents in the entire village survived. They were all transformed into biommonsters and then continued to spread to the surrounding areas.

And at this very moment, the troops dispatched by Kishaurro are still on their way. Chapter 160 completely out of control. On a mountain road, a long convoy of military vehicles sped along. Ordinary Japanese soldiers on the road were filled with curiosity when they saw it. What's going on? Why are so many troops being deployed? Our island has been quite quiet lately.

We haven't provoked anyone. Could it be that the Great Sa Kingdom is causing us trouble again? Many Japanese soldiers were speculating. They don't know what's going on yet. However, they will find out soon enough. On the other side, Yamamoto Taro sat in the command post, his eyes filled with anxiety.

How long until the troops reach the outskirts of the base? Report: At most half an hour. Another half hour, Yamamoto Taro said, somewhat dissatisfied. Tell them to speed things up and try to get there in 20 minutes. Okay. After receiving the order, the frontline troops began to accelerate at breakneck speed.

20 minutes later, they finally reached the outskirts of the base about 5 km away. Reporting to headquarters, we have reached the outer perimeter. The frontline commander is giving a report. Sudden bang. A loud bang came from behind the convoy.

The frontline commander turned around abruptly. In the rear view mirror, the window of the last military vehicle suddenly shattered. A blood soaked monster was outside the vehicle, viciously biting a soldier's neck. Baka, what's that? The frontline commander was terrified. At the same time, more biommonsters rushed out of the woods by the roadside.

They launched an attack on the Japanese army. Upon seeing this, the soldiers immediately opened fire in retaliation. Da da da. However, the bullets did not kill the biommon. This scene utterly terrified the Japanese soldiers.

Baka bullets are useless against them. Run. These monsters are invincible. Oh, my leg. Help me.

Screams, gunshots, and the roars of monsters mingled together. The frontline commander pushed open the car door, drew his pistol, and rushed to the rear. The highway was in complete chaos. Three bio-engineered monsters are tearing apart a soldier. Their skin was bluish black.

Their muscles were bulging and their eyes were scarlet. The soldier's rifle bullets hit them, leaving only white marks. They couldn't penetrate them at all. Concentrate your firepower on the head. The captain roared and pointed his gun at the monster's head.

Bang! Bang! Bang! Three bullets hit their targets in quick succession. The monster's head shook, but instead of falling, it became even more ferocious. It pounced on the squad leader beside it and bit off his throat. Blood splattered on the front line commander's face. His whole body was ice cold and his hands were trembling.

This is something that humans simply cannot fight against. Retreat. Retreat quickly behind the armored vehicles. The frontline commander roared and turned to run towards the command vehicle. However, the biommonsters were extremely fast, catching up with the fleeing soldiers in just a few seconds.

Screams continued to ring out. The frontline commander hid behind an armored vehicle, his face deathly pale. Quick, used a rocket launcher. The soldiers snapped out of their days and quickly picked up their rocket launchers. Aim, fire, boom.

The rocket, trailing flames, struck a monster. An explosion rang out and the monster's body was blown to pieces. efficient, the survivors were instantly filled with hope. But the next second, even more monsters rushed out of the forest. A full thousand behind them followed a pack of mutated wild dogs and wild boars.

The wild dog was twice the size of a normal dog, and its teeth were as sharp as knives. Wild boars have skin as hard as iron, and bits of meat still cling to their tusks. How can there be so many? The frontline commander was completely panicked. They didn't bring many rockets. The last round of launches has already consumed half of the energy.

There's no way to stop so many monsters. Thinking of this, the frontline commander immediately reported to Yamamoto. General, something terrible has happened. The infection source is out of control. Those infected have turned into monsters.

In the office, Kishidurro sat in a chair, his hands behind his head. His body was still trembling. He didn't know if his decision could save the country of cherry blossoms.

He knew what the consequences of this decision would be, but he had no way out. Alternatively, it could be controlled by the great Sia kingdom or let the entire planet Earth descend into chaos. He chose the latter. Chapter 164. or the Sakura country goes completely crazy.

All troops that were trying to stop the biommonsters have been withdrawn. Self-defense forces from other regions are also being deployed eastward through the surrounding areas.

Other regions, we can ignore them. The last few words spoken lightly carried a chilling undertone. Taro Yamamoto's pupils shrank sharply and his face turned deathly pale. Primer Minister, have you gone mad? He rushed forward two steps, his voice trembling with tears. There are still hundreds of millions of people in other regions.

Without an army to stop them, those monsters will devour the entire Sakura country. We cannot abandon them. Kishidurro gave a cold laugh, his eyes as cold as ice. Give up. From the moment the UN General Assembly passed a resolution, we had no way out.

His eyes were bloodshot like those of a wild beast out of control. Yamamoto Taro was intimidated by his imposing presence, his lips trembling, unable to utter a word.

But for the future of the northern bear kingdom, this is the only way. Desert tycoon country region. the palace of the Sartra kingdom. The old kings eyes gleamed as he looked at the great Sia Kingdom's South Heavenly Gate project. He looked at the Minister of Commerce, his voice excited.

The Great Sea Kingdom has established the Nanchiman project. Can we purchase their space station? What? Buy a space station? The Minister of Commerce was completely dumbfounded. What's going on here? Why would someone want to sell their perfectly good space station? That's right. you should contact the great sea kingdom immediately and see if they're interested in selling the space station. The price is negotiable.

He originally wanted to directly invest in the Nanchiman project, but the great SEA Kingdom would refuse. As long as we buy back the space station of the Great Sa Kingdom, their kingdom of SAT is a nation that possesses a space station. Zhaokai's eyes lit up and he immediately began to operate the robotic arm. Activate the special laser drill bit. A pale blue laser beam was emitted from the front end of the robotic arm. In an instant, a hole was drilled in the rock straighta. Pale blue powder slowly drifted out as the drill bit rotated.

Very good. Chinfong shouted excitedly. I've discovered a mineral vein here, too. Me, too. The excited voices of the team members came through the communicator.
