A few minutes later, the location of the life signal source was finally determined. It's actually 50 m below the perafrost. You've kept it well hidden. He took a deep breath, suppressing his excitement. Start automatic digging.

Target 50 m below the perafrost. The instruction has been issued. The mining truck was making a loud roar. The robotic arm slowly adjusted its angle. A special drill bit extends, flashing a pale blue laser.

Begin digging. When the drill bit touches the ice surface, the frozen layer is cut into ice chips. The mechanical claw at the back directly transfers the ice shards to the rear. As excavation continues, the other team members also express their concern about the progress. Brother Foam, how's it going? Did you find anything? Zhao Kais voice was full of anticipation and concern.

Shinfong stared intently at the screen and said irritably, we've only just started digging. It's a long way off. Lena chimed in, a hint of mischievous anticipation in her voice. Could it be an alien monster? I'd love if it were furry. It's in a woman's nature to like furry things.

Even aliens are no exception. Lena even had the idea of keeping aliens as pets. Shinfong was speechless. Stop thinking nonsense. Focus on mining your star stones.

Don't miss any. He spoke seriously, but he was equally curious. What exactly is hidden beneath this layer of ice? The drill bit continued to descend. 10 m, 20 m, 30 m. With each meter, he went deeper.

Shinfangs heart beat faster. Inside the cockpit, there was only the faint sound of instruments running. Everyone held their breath as if afraid of disturbing the life beneath the ice. 40 m. The detector suddenly emitted a rapid beep sound.

Warning. Approaching signal source. Chinfong instantly became even more nervous. We're only 10 m away from the location of the life signal source. At this point, the robotic arm moves even more gently.

It's like touching a fragile treasure. We'll reach 50 m very soon. The drill bit suddenly felt lighter. It's through. Chinfong immediately stopped drilling and switched to sampling mode.

A sampling claw extends from the end of the robotic arm. Slowly probe into the ice hole you just drilled out. A moment later, the sampling claw was retracted. It held a pale blue block of ice in its paws, measuring 50 cm. The detector indicated that the source of the life signal was at the center of the ice block.

We finally found it, Chunfong exclaimed, filled with excitement and anticipation. When the ice was retrieved back to the mining vehicle, Chinfong was dumbfounded again. What about life? What about the aliens? The entire block of ice was almost transparent. The entire block of ice can be seen through with the naked eye, but nothing was found if it weren't for the detector constantly giving warnings. Chinfong thought they had dug the wrong hole.

It seems to be just some microorganisms. Chinfong secretly guessed what was going on, then operated the robotic arm to put the ice into a specially designed insulated box. Finally, it was placed directly into the storage compartment of the mining vehicle for safekeeping. After everything was done, Shan Fong finally breathed a sigh of relief. "Finally, the sampling is complete." The team chat was buzzing with inquiries.

Lina was the most excited. "Brother Fong, did you dig one up? Is it an alien?" Zhokai also asked anxiously. "Brother Fo, quickly show us what the aliens look like." Chinfong explained helplessly. "You're overthinking it. It's not some alien.

It's probably just microorganisms or some other life form." "What? Just microbial life?" Lina was filled with disappointment. Zhaokai sighed. Alas, it seems our hopes of seeing aliens have been dashed once again. Chinfong ignored them and contacted the uniform center directly. Command center life signal sample has been obtained, requesting further instructions.

Chenfong stood at attention and responded, then shouted to his teammates. Lina, Zhaokai, you two are responsible for sending the samples and stares back to Earth. The others continued mining. Receive. Lina and Zha Kai responded excitedly.

The cargo hold closed slowly. Lina and Zha Kai returned to the cockpit of the space plane. Then the Kuing space plane is launched.

The anti-gravity plasma engine has started working. The Kuing space plane slowly ascended into the air, then accelerated away from lunar orbit. They sped off towards the direction of blue star. The tail flame left a dazzling trail of light in the darkness. After seeing Lin Na and Zha Kai take off successfully, Chinfong continued to give instructions.

Everyone, let's go back to mining and try to complete the mission as soon as possible. 3 hours later, Blue Star, Great Sa Kingdom, Kimping Space Base. Lie Jian Guo and Lynchin stood side by side. Professor Jean couldn't help but ask Lyn Shun.

He wasn't sure either, but even cellular life has very important research significance. Cells that can survive at minus200Â° C must have something unique about them. Just as Professor Jeang was about to say something more, then we heard the exclamations of the RD staff.

Look, cell structures have appeared. Everyone's attention was focused on the large test screen. On the screen, tiny single cell structures emerge. Its appearance is simple, yet it is full of vitality. It's a single-sellled life form.

It's amazing. There really is life on the moon. Professor Jang and his colleagues were filled with curiosity, excitement, and anticipation. Professor Jang analyzed the gene sequence immediately. Lynchin ordered, "Yes, Chief Engineer Lynn." Professor Jeang responded and then instructed the other RD staff to get to work.

A moment later, the results were in. Professor Ciangs voice trembled after seeing the final data. Its existence time is over 100,000 years. Terrifying. The entire room fell silent.

Everyone was shocked by this number. Lynshin stared at the single-sellled life in the image, his eyes filled with excitement. The most primitive single-sellled organisms can survive for 100,000 years in the extreme environment of the moon. This is a miracle of life, Lie Jian Guo exclaimed in surprise. It's truly baffling that a single-sellled organism can survive for so long.

This is more valuable than extraterrestrial life. Its cellular structure allows it to survive in vacuum, low temperature, and radiation. This vitality far surpasses that of any living organism on Earth. If we could crack its genetic code, Lynn Shin chimed in, his voice brimming with excitement. The life sciences of the great Sa Kingdom are about to experience an epic leap forward.

Chapter 183. It is the future of humanity. Throughout the laboratory, everyone stared in disbelief. They were all deeply shocked by the single-sellled life on the moon. What does it mean to have a single-sellled organism that can survive for 100,000 years? It has never appeared on Earth.

Currently, no long-ived animal on Earth has lived for more than a thousand years. The saying, "A000-year-old tortoise, a 10,000-year-old turtle," is just a famous saying. But in reality, reality does not exist. Professor Jang remained in a state of shock, repeatedly muttering, "100,000 years. 100,000 years.

Lynn Shin's eyes were filled with excitement as he immediately issued a new order. Start full-scale testing immediately. As the image is magnified, the details of the cell wall gradually become clear. A few seconds later, Professor Jeang suddenly exclaimed, "My god, how is this possible?" The crowd immediately gathered around.

On the screen, the cell walls appear as a complex network structure. Countless tiny crystal latises intertwine, shimmering with a pale blue luster. This is not an ordinary cell wall. Its structure is very stable and it is composed of some kind of unknown crystal able to survive at absolute zero and ultra high temperatures. This discovery undoubtedly overturned his understanding of biological science.

Having worked in life sciences for decades, this was the first time he had encountered such a miraculous life form. Upon hearing this, Lynch was also filled with curiosity. It's actually made of crystals. This is getting more and more interesting. He was filled with curiosity about this single-sellled life form.

Professor Jang suppressed his excitement and continued the procedure. The image was magnified again. The cell nucleus appears directly on the large screen. When you see the structure of the cell nucleus, Professor Jeang exclaimed in surprise. This it's actually a triple helix structure.

This once again overturned his understanding. All life on the entire blue star world is a double helix structure. Some scientists have also suggested that there are other biological cells with different structures in the world. However, this has never been confirmed and now it has been discovered on the moon. That's amazing.

All the researchers around were filled with shock and excitement. Their eyes gleamed with a fervent desire to explore the unknown. The final test results are now available. Everyone in the laboratory was completely shocked. Even Lynch is no exception. Lynch stared at the screen, lost in thought. The result was very close to his guess.

This concerns humanity's future space development relying solely on technology.

There are even many cosmic life forms with lifespans exceeding 10,000 years. Special gene fragment discovered. These genes encode some kind of protective mechanism. It can induce a state of suspended animation in cells under extreme conditions. Professor Jeang leaned closer for a closer look, his voice excited. Look here.

And Starstone can achieve 100% accuracy. It's simply incredible.

Countless streams of data flooded into his mind like a tidal wave. The structure of the gene chain and the ratio of drug components. Control of the activity of various enzymes. Scenes flashed before his eyes. Lynchin closed his eyes and carefully process this information.

Primary gene enhancing agents primarily function to unlock the body's genetic potential, strengthen the body's basic constitution and boost immunity. With normal human organs, a person can live up to 120 years. I see Lynch and opened his eyes, his eyes filled with excitement. Even a basic gene-enhancing drug can allow humans to live to an average age of 120. What if we incorporated the genes of single-sellled life on the moon? How much longer will it increase lifespan? Is it really possible to adapt to all kinds of extreme environments? And it can self-repair and autonomously evolve.

Thinking about this, Lynchin couldn't wait to put it into practice. The space for inheritance contains experimental tools and materials. First, we need to optimize the formula of the primary gene drug to make it mass-producible in the Great Sea Kingdom. Then we'll figure out a way to incorporate the genes of single-sellled life on the moon. Lynn Shan went directly to the inheritance space laboratory.

The laboratory has been transformed into a biological laboratory. Following Lynch's ideas, various precision instruments are neatly arranged. The liquid in the reagent bottle shimmerred with different colors of light. Lynchin walked to the workbench and picked up a test tube. The excitement in my heart was hard to contain.

Let's begin. First, we'll create basic rudimentary gene-based medicine. Then, Lin Shun conducted various experiments in the inheritance space. The primary gene serum contains many materials that are not found on Earth. We must find a similar material to replace it.

In particular, key materials for unlocking the human gene pool, a special kind of biological enzyme. It has never appeared on Earth before. Finding alternatives has become extremely difficult. Lynshin could only keep experimenting until the next morning. Match successful can replace raw materials.

Haha, I finally found it. Lynchin became excited when he saw the result. He tried at least 9,527,886 times throughout the night. He finally found a replacement. Solve the most difficult material substitution problem.

The rest became simple. Now, let's go see if Professor Jang and his team have made any discoveries. Lyn Shun withdrew from the inheritance space. Quickly wash up. Then I went to the cafeteria for breakfast.

Professor Jeang was hunched over the microscope, his eyes bloodshot. He had a layer of stubble on his chin, and there were traces of reagent on his clothes. Some were dozing off in their chairs, still holding data sheets in their hands. Some stared at the screen, not daring to blink. Suddenly, an engineer exclaimed, "Professor Jeang, look." The break point in the gene chain matches up. Professor Jeang suddenly raised his head, his eyes instantly lighting up. He rushed to the screen, his fingers flying across the keyboard.

Professor Ciangs voice trembled and he almost burst into tears. I stayed up for three nights and tried hundreds of methods. We finally cracked that damn genetic lock. Just then, the laboratory door was pushed open. Lynch walked in.

They all began to divide up the tasks. The mice's cells were quickly extracted. Engineers used a robotic arm to precisely place a test tube containing a single cell gene fragment from the moon onto a cultured dish of mouse cells, ready to inject. 3 2 1. The pale blue liquid was poured into the petri dish.

Everyone held their breath and stared at the screen. 1 second 2 seconds 3 seconds. Suddenly, the mouse cells in the petri dish began to fluctuate violently. The gene sequences on the screen have started to recombine. Success.

The fusion was a success. Chapter 188, A Miracle in Genetics. While everyone was in shock, the gene sequence map on the screen is already quietly changing. Upon witnessing this, Professor Jeang exclaimed in astonishment, "It's moving. It's really recombinating its genes.

It's evolving." By the end, his voice was trembling. And he was even becoming somewhat incoherent. He has been in the industry for over 40 years and has seen at least 800, if not a thousand, gene experiments. Never before had he felt his blood boil like this. What about human cells? Is it possible to do that? The moment this thought popped into Lin Chen's head, his eyes lit up. We need to investigate the stability of the recombinant gene, its environmental adaptability, and the degree of preservation of gene fragment activity, especially stability. If the gene chain is prone to breakage after fusion, everything else is just empty talk.

Professor Jang slapped his thigh somewhat excited. Chief Engineer Lynn is right. I was just too happy to think about it. Don't just stand there. Get ready for testing immediately.

The first result came out quickly. Upon seeing the data, Professor Xang exclaimed again. Chief engineer Lynn, the results are in. The fused gene chain is extremely stable. Look, after three consecutive sequencing runs, the arrangement of the gene fragments hasn't changed at all.

It's even more stable than a native cell. Lynch immediately looked at the results, which showed that the gene fragments had not changed at all and were even more stable than the original cells. This result also relieved Lin Chun. The environmental test results followed shortly after. Chief Engineer Lynn, the low temperature test has passed.

At minus200Â° C, the cells are still metabolizing normally. The radiation test has passed. Under simulated strong cosmic radiation, there was no damage to the DNA. High temperature test. My god, 150Â° C.

The cells only showed a slight decrease in activity. They didn't die. Professor Jeang practically shouted it out by the end moment. The entire laboratory erupted in cheers. My god, it's even fine in temperatures of 150Â° C.

It can even withstand cosmic radiation. If this were used on humans, going to space would be as easy as strolling in a park. Outrageous. This isn't a biological cell. It's almost like an alloy material.

Professor Jeang looked at Lynn Chun, his voice filled with shock. Chief Engineer Lynn, a miracle. This is absolutely a genetic miracle. The fuse cells not only retained the environmental adaptability of lunar single cells but also inherited the activity of mouse cells. More importantly, there was no rejection reaction between the two genes.

Lynchin couldn't help but nod, his excitement barely contained. This result has exceeded my expectations. He looked at the petri dish, his eyes gleaming. Now we can move on to the next step. Professor Jang immediately pressed further.

The next step is a human cell experiments. Lynch shook his head. Let's do experiments on live mice first. Success at the cellular level does not guarantee success at the living organism level. We need to confirm whether the fusion gene can be expressed normally in living organisms and whether it will actually lead to the evolution of living genes.

That's the most important thing. Only the live experiment was successful. That means the special genes of single-sellled life on the moon could also drive the evolution of human genes. Professor Jeang paused for a moment, then suddenly realized, "That's right. I was too hasty.

Live experiments are the key." He immediately turned to his team and shouted, "Prepare live mice immediately. Inject them into the body according to the fusion protocol we just discussed. This time, we must be fully prepared and use all kinds of monitoring equipment." The engineers immediately sprang into action. Soon, several healthy mice were sent to the laboratory. Staff operated a robotic arm to carefully draw the fused gene fluid into a syringe, which was then precisely injected into the mice.

After the injection, the mice were placed in a specially designed observation box. The observation box is connected to various monitoring instruments, which can monitor the mouse's heart rate, body temperature, and gene expression in real time. Everyone stood around the observation box staring intently. Even Lin Chun became nervous at this moment. The most crucial step is the live experiment with mice.

Whether it succeeds or not will affect the formulation of subsequent primary gene therapy drugs. He was just working on material substitution issues at the Heritage Space Lab last night. The fusion of specific genes has not yet been carried out. If the real world experiment is successful, this will allow him to do fewer experiments. The waiting time is always agonizing.

Almost every second felt like centuries. 1 minute, 2 minutes, 3 minutes. The mice initially scured around in the box, but quickly calmed down and looked no different from ordinary mice. Shia Wong stared intently at the monitoring screen. Heart rate normal, body temperature normal, gene expression has started.

Professor Jeang leaned closer and looked at the gene fragments that gradually lit up on the screen. Very good. The expression rate is very stable with no abnormal fluctuations. Time passed little by little. An hour later, old Lou and his team switched the observation box to low temperature mode.

The temperature inside the box dropped rapidly, quickly falling to minus 100Â° C. Everyone held their breath. At this temperature, a normal white mouse would die in less than 5 minutes. The white mouse in the observation box only curled up for a moment, but it was still slowly moving. "It's not dead, it's still alive," Shiaolong shouted excitedly.

Professor Jeang immediately ordered, "Continue to lower the temperature. Lower it to -200Â° C." The temperature continued to drop. -50Â° C, - 180Â° C, -200Â° C. The air inside the observation box seemed to freeze. Although the mice moved more slowly, they still showed no signs of dying.

On the monitoring screen, its heart rate had decreased, but it was still within the normal range. My god, it really can withstand -200Â° C. Old L's voice was filled with disbelief. What does -200Â° C mean? If a person were in this kind of environment, they would be frozen into an ice sculpture in less than a second. And now the mice are actually able to move around normally, even sci-fi movies wouldn't dare to film something like this.

Seeing this scene, Lynchin finally felt relieved. Success at the cellular level has also been validated at the invivo level. Next, we need to expand the experiment to ensure the accuracy of the data. Chapter 189. Expanding the scope of the experiment.

Professor Jeang was still staring excitedly at the data on the screen, muttering to himself. Everything is surprisingly normal. Heart rate fluctuations did not exceed 4%. Most importantly, there was no rejection reaction, not even a little bit. I've been doing biological experiments for 30 years, and I've never seen such outrageous results.

In addition, you don't have to worry about heat stroke in the summer or getting cold in the winter. Just thinking about it is exciting. Lynchin looked at the excited Professor Jeang and smiled slightly. Professor Jeang, now is not the time to get excited. This is just a preliminary test.

I suggest further expanding the scope of the trial. In addition to increasing testing on mice, we also need to start testing on chimpanzees. At the same time, we will consider testing on humans only after the chimpanzeee tests are successful. Chimpanzees are the animals whose genes are most closely related to humans as long as it passes the test. Therefore, conducting subsequent human testing would significantly reduce the risks.

It's important to know that the distance between Earth and Mars is not constant. Instead, the distance between the two planets will vary greatly depending on their positions in their respective orbits. The closest distance is only 55 million km. The furthest distance reached a staggering 400 million km. The difference between the two is seven or eight times.

Their latest technological breakthrough can only achieve an interplanetary cruising speed of Mach 30. Even the shortest distance of 5,500 km would take 60 days to fly in a straight line. This is the ideal flight route. However, in actual space travel, it is impossible to fly in a straight line. He needs to consider factors such as gravitational boost and orbital insertion.

So, the actual flight time is often longer than the ideal straight line flight time. The fastest Mars probes launched by the United States took 6 to 9 months to reach Mars. Even if there is improvement now, it will still take 4 to 6 months. But the spaceship hasn't even started building yet. How is it possible to land on Mars in 6 months? But Optton wouldn't listen.

He stuck to his own ideas. Go and post the announcement first. As long as you can set off within 6 months, there will be no problem. He just wants to make empty promises to the people in his country. This is to alleviate the increasingly serious internal conflicts within their country.

Otherwise, he might not even live to see the change of leadership before he has to step down. After all, hundreds of billions of dollars have been invested in research and development. It also brought together all the scientists from the entire Eagle Alliance. If they don't produce some results, how can they explain themselves to the public? Seeing Optin's unwavering resolve, Trudeau had no choice but to reluctantly agree to hold the press conference. Setting off 6 months later is barely acceptable.

He definitely couldn't land on Mars within 6 months. But setting off 6 months later is a different story. An hour later, seen from a White House press conference, Durret held up the microphone, his voice booming. I hereby announce that the United States has officially launched its Mars colonization plan. The words fell. The flash bulbs from the audience went off like crazy. However, the applause at the scene was sparse. Instead, they looked at Durit with more skeptical eyes. Some reporters even raised their hands to ask questions.

Understood, brother. Foam. Zhaokai and Lina dared not ask any more questions. The mining trucks of team one and team two continued to mine the star stone. The mining vehicles of teams three and four adjusted their directions.

5 m, 10 m, 15 m. Beep beep beep beep. The detector's alarm suddenly became urgent. Shunfangs breathing instantly quickened with excitement. Found it again.

Chapter 193, Autonomous Devouring. Lyn Shun was also slightly shocked when he saw the block of ice. Upon hearing Professor Cenangs question, he frowned slightly.

We can't see the cause at the moment. Well have to wait until we get a microscope to determine the specifics. Then he arranged for the engineers to start using the microscope. Engineers operate a robotic arm to transfer a block of purple ice under a microscope.

Everyone's eyes were fixed on the large screen of the microscope. The next second, they witnessed a scene they would never forget. The single-sellled life inside the ice is swimming wildly. Those things are frantically gathering towards the center of the ice. It was as if something there was attracting them.

Piss. What is that? So many tiny life forms have gathered here. Wow. So, they live in groups, too. All the engineers were astonished.

Under the microscope, those lunar single-sellled life forms are densely packed together. People with trypophobia would probably faint if they saw this. The quantity is impossible to estimate at the moment. At this moment, Professor Jeang discovered an even more amazing scene. When those single-sellled organisms got close, they made a bizarre move.

A small single cell suddenly collided with a large one. Then the larger single cell swallowed the smaller one hole. Holy crap, they're actually devouring each other on their own. Professor Jeang was so excited that he immediately started reciting traditional Chinese cultural classics. Even Lin Shan was stunned by this scene, exclaiming, "This is amazing." I originally thought that these single-sellled life forms were simply able to adapt to harsh environments to survive.

I never expected such a magical scene. They can even devour themselves. Is this how they've managed to survive? The more Lynchin thought about it, the more excited he became. He immediately ordered, "Enlarge the microscope." He wanted to see a clearer picture. Yes, Chief Engineer Lynn.

The engineer quickly adjusted the microscope magnification. Instantly, the image became clearer. The single-sellled life forms at the center of the ice block went mad. They collided and devoured each other. Each time it devours one of its own kind, its size increases by one size.

The color also became increasingly darker. It started as a transparent color, then turned into a light blue and gradually became a light purple. Are they devouring and evolving? It feels like we're raising a venomous insect. This is amazing. Even single-sellled life forms exhibit this kind of devouring and evolutionary behavior.

Everyone was deeply shocked by this scene, and they all chimed in with their own comments. It can only be said that no matter how small the creature, there will always be a king of curls. Survival of the fittest exists in any environment. Professor Jeang was completely numb, muttering to himself, "A miracle. This is simply a biological miracle." Lyn Shan was a little surprised.

It's actually devouring and evolving. That's amazing. Single-sellled organisms can devour each other. This is definitely unusual. Do they have self-awareness, or is this their evolutionary path? Lynchin became more and more excited as he thought about it.

If we can figure out the underlying principles, optimization of primary gene agents might lead to a breakthrough. A moment later, Professor Jeang also came to his senses. Chief Engineer Lynn, do you think they've already developed consciousness? Hard to say. Lynchin wasn't sure either. Perhaps it's just an instinct.

The idea that single-sellled life forms possess consciousness directly contradicts science. He prefers to believe it's a biological instinct. Yes, it must be an instinct. Professor Jeang nodded in agreement. This is the only reasonable explanation.

10 minutes later. Originally, there were hundreds of single cells, but now only a dozen or so remain. Each one is three times the size of the previous one. The color turned dark purple. They continued to devour.

Finally, only the largest single cell remained. At this point, the single-sellled organism seemed to have eaten its fill and suddenly lay flat. It stopped moving directly inside the ice. This This is it. That's amazing.

It swallowed so much that only one cell remained. The crucial point is after swallowing for so long, it's still just a single-sellled life form in the end. It seems to have simply eaten its own kind to continue surviving. The engineers were whispering among themselves. Indeed, this situation was somewhat beyond their expectations.

They originally thought that these single-sellled organisms would evolve into more advanced organisms after consuming them. It turns out to be a single-sellled organism. It's just that it's gotten bigger. Professor Jeang was also a bit confused. Chief engineer Lynn, what's going on? Has the evolution failed? Lynshin was also a little confused and shook his head.

It's hard to say right now. I suggest we test his genes first to see if there are any changes. Good. Professor Jeang immediately arranged for engineers to begin testing the genes of that fat man's cell. He had a suspicion in his mind. The current difficulty in fusing primary gene agents lies precisely in insufficient gene activity. If we could simulate this process of absorption to ensure that gene fragments maintain high activity during fusion, this might solve the problem of single-sellled organism genes fusing into human genes. Thinking of this, he immediately said, "Professor Jeang, please focus on gene activity and stability later." Professor Jeang nodded solemnly. "Good." A moment later, the ice has completely melted.

The fat single-sellled organism inside was also carefully transferred to a petri dish. Then it was sent to the gene testing instrument. The engineer began operating the gene testing equipment. The data kept jumping on the screen. A few minutes later, the results came out.

Professor Jeang looked at the data and exclaimed in surprise, "Chief engineer Lynn, this is amazing. The gene activity of the single cell after fagocytosis is 10 times that before. Stability has also improved five-fold." Lynn Chen's eyes lit up. Sure enough, his guess was right. Old Jang, we have a new direction.

Chapter 195. The strong only need to set the rules. All appearances are settled using or. Li Jian Guo was stunned for a moment. Then his eyes suddenly lit up.

That's right. Now that we're powerful, we should be the ones to set the rules. Back then, when the great Sia Kingdom wanted to join the World Trade Organization, it went through countless hardships before finally succeeding. Even so, at that time, Western countries such as the United States added layers of pressure. However, even under these circumstances, the Great Sea Kingdom, relying on its thousands of years of wisdom, managed to emerge from the chaos and gradually develop.

Nowadays, they can arbitrarily set international rules and no country dares to stand up and oppose them. Minister Sun returned to the Ministry of Commerce. He immediately called his secretary in immediately notify the delegation from India.

Just say I summoned them. Tell them to come here now. Immediately the secretary didn't dare delay and immediately turned to make a phone call. Less than half an hour. The delegation from India arrived in a hurry.

The leader was the foreign minister of India. As soon as he entered the meeting room, he had a big smile on his face. Minister son, is there good news? Your country has agreed to sell rocket technology. Minister son sat in the main seat looking calm and composed. Agreement is agreement but we have one condition.

The Indian foreign minister felt a pang of anxiety and the smile on his face froze for a moment. Condition you said it and we will never refuse to do anything we can. Minister son looked up and his gaze fell on him. We don't want food and we don't want foreign exchange. We want rocket technology.

You must exchange it for high purity or iron ore or or copper or either is fine. Trading with or the Indian foreign minister was stunned. His mouth opened and closed but he couldn't say a word for a long time. The members of the delegation behind him were all dumbfounded. They looked at each other their eyes filled with disbelief.

Or the great kingdom only wants minerals. You should know that India has no shortage of minerals. The iron or veins within the territory are so plentiful that you can easily find high purity iron or by simply digging around. They were still wondering what harsh conditions the Great Sea Kingdom would impose. Are they asking them to seed territory or should we ask them to open their markets? They were even prepared to be ripped off.

But now the great Sia Kingdom only wants minerals. This is like a windfall. The Indian foreign minister realized what was happening and slapped his thigh. Agreed. We agree.

It's just or we have plenty. Just tell us how many you need. We'll arrange transportation right away. The smile on his face was 10 times brighter than before. My heart was bursting with joy and I felt like I had gotten a tremendous advantage.

The other delegations from India and Afghanistan had similar expressions. They all looked like they had gotten a huge advantage as if they were afraid that minister son would go back on his word. Minister son looked at him and sneered inwardly but remained outwardly calm. Specific share. My men will handle things with you.

Remember, if the or is not pure enough, the transaction is void. The Indian foreign minister nodded quickly. Don't worry, it's definitely high purity. I'll go back and prepare right away. I'll leave a colleague to discuss the specific share with you.

Okay. Minister son nodded as if to see the guest out. The Indian foreign minister bid farewell and immediately got up to leave. The speed at which he walked was as if he were rushing to be reincarnated. It was as if Minister's son was afraid that if he was even a step too late, he would regret it.

As he walked out of the Ministry of Commerce building, the Indian foreign minister finally couldn't help but burst into laughter. I never expected this. The great Sia Kingdom is so easy to talk to. Trading or for rocket technology. We've made a killing this time.

Haha. Those passing by stared at the Indian foreign minister and his entourage as if they were idiots. The Indian foreign minister didn't care at all about the strange looks he received. Upon hearing this, Lie Jiano felt a warmth in his heart.

Don't worry, we will keep a close eye on every step. Then the elderly man gave a few more instructions and then ended the video conference. After the old man turned off the video conference, a glint of shrewdness flashed in his eyes. It's time to let the whole nation know about comrade Xin, this great hero. Chapter 200, giving Lynn Chin a recognition.

It's time. The elderly man, Tian Shu, picked up the phone. Notify the others that we will have a meeting in the conference room in 10 minutes. 10 minutes later, the conference room was brightly lit. Several senior executives arrived one after another.

Seeing that Ton Shu was waiting in advance, they all put away their usual relaxed demeanor. Ton Shu, why did you summon us so urgently? Is something important? The leader of the Ton Shu nodded, his voice authoritative. I've called you here for only one thing. It's time to give comrade Lynn Chin a proper title. Everyone in the conference room paused for a moment, then nodded in support.

It's definitely time to vindicate comrade Lin Shan support. It's time to let the people know who our great hero is. Haha. The tion shu ship gestured for them to speak. His voice steady yet powerful.

Now the technology of the great Sia Kingdom has reached the pinnacle of the blue star. Comrade Lin Chin's contributions must be remembered. My idea is to give him the highest honor. The National Science and Technology Progress Award, Special Prize, the National Medal. Give it all to him.

Everyone was stunned by these words. National medal that is the highest honor. Very few people are able to obtain it. But they had no objection to giving it to Lynch. Because of Lyn Shun, the Great Sa Kingdom entered the space age decades ahead of schedule.

It was also because of Lin Shan that the Great Sea Kingdom was able to completely break free from the days of being held hostage. He deserves these honors. General Jeang from the military headquarters immediately chimed in. I agree. Space fighter jets, lunar bases, space cities.

Aren't these all game-changing projects? Giving him the highest honor is not only a reward but also a signal to all researchers. The others nodded in agreement. And another thing, the leader of the Ton Shu continued, is the establishment of an interstellar academy of sciences specifically responsible for research related to space exploration and interstellar development. Comrade Lin Shan was appointed as the chief scientist within the Academy of Sciences. He holds the highest authority.

No one, no department may interfere with his research decisions. This shocked everyone even more. The highest authority. This practically handed over the entire interstellar future of the great Sia Kingdom to Lin Chan. Could this be? Some people worry that the power is too great.

The leader of the Ton Shu interrupted him, saying, "Trust those you employ, and don't employ those you don't trust." Comrade Lin Shens vision and ability are greater than we imagined. Moreover, Interstellar Exploration is a completely new field, and it must be decided by professionals. No one objected anymore. The awards ceremony is scheduled for 2 weeks from now. The location is the great hall of the people.

The protocol should be the highest level of etiquette. Furthermore, Comrade Lin Chin's security level has been raised to the highest level. The next morning, the top news story on the great Sea Kingdom's news broadcast. An announcement instantly went viral across the internet. A ceremony to award the nation's highest honor will be held at the Great Hall of the People in 2 weeks, recognizing individuals who have made outstanding contributions to the nation's scientific and technological development.

The announcement was very short. No names were mentioned, nor were specific contributions discussed. But the words, "The highest national honor" are enough to excite everyone. Holy crap, the highest honor. Who's going to receive this? Could it be the team that previously developed controlled nuclear fusion? I feel there's more than that.

There's bound to be a surprise. Could it be the team from the space city project? It must be a big project. Otherwise, they wouldn't have used the highest level of protocol. topic instantly went viral on Weibo's trending searches. The highest honor in the great SEA kingdom was awarded directly reaching the top.

The comments section is full of speculation. Is it possible that it's some hidden big shot? The Nanchin and the space carrier were technologies that suddenly appeared. Maybe there's a super big shot behind him. No matter who it is, they are all the pride of our great sa kingdom. People have started to take stock of potential candidates from the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the Chinese Academy of Engineering to research teams.

A long list was compiled, but no one is sure. After all, the weight of the highest honor is simply too great. The international internet was also in an uproar. Is the great Sea Kingdom preparing to announce the identity of a special individual? I don't know why, but I'm actually kind of looking forward to it. I wonder which technological giant from the great SEA kingdom will be announced.

No matter what, they deserve our respect. The entire Blue Star Network is buzzing about this. The person who could warrant such a grand announcement from the Great Sea Kingdom must be a key figure in the recent technological explosion in the Great Sia Kingdom. Across the Pacific Ocean, an office, a familiar face looked at the announcement and fell into deep thought. What is the Great Sea Kingdom up to now? Is it possible that they are preparing to release some information? Intelligence Agency's Trif stood to the side and explained in a low voice.

President, I suspect it may be related to the technological explosion in the great Sia Kingdom. Huang nodded. No matter what they do, we can only gather information on the surface. We absolutely must not send any agents into the Great Sea Kingdom. Understand? Huh? Trife was a little confused.

Mr. President, with such a good opportunity, shouldn't we? Before he could finish speaking, he was interrupted. Fool, can't you even see through such a simple scheme? The Great Sa Kingdom just wants to lure us into doing something and then find an excuse to deal with us. If we dare to cause trouble, the consequences will be dire. This Upon hearing this, Tri felt a chill run down his spine.

He had just been thinking of taking this opportunity to investigate the important mission of the Great Sia Kingdom and then resolve it secretly. They never imagined that the great SEA kingdom had set a trap for them. The president is wise. Well just watch this time. Trif complimented at the same time.

India, should we send someone to investigate secretly? The secretary asked in a low voice. Are you stupid? The charlatan glared at the secretary. We're trying to avoid the great Sia Kingdom right now, and you want to provoke them? Are you complaining that our Indian country is having too much of a comfortable time lately? After saying that, still not satisfied, he yelled, "Get out of here. You're fired." "Huh?" The secretary was completely dumbfounded. She was fired just because of one sentence.

"Your excellency, please give me a chance. I The secretary immediately knelt on the ground and begged for mercy." But the charlatan's face was cold as he shouted at the door. "Guards, come in right now and drag this guy away." Soon, the guards came in and dragged the secretary away. Only then did the charlatan breathe a sigh of relief. Do you still want to provoke the Great Sa Kingdom? What an idiot.

The charlatan muttered a few words, still not at ease. Then another order was issued. No department was allowed to investigate matters concerning the Great Sa Kingdom. It's not just the US and India that reacted this way. Almost the entire Earth reacted the same way.

But there is one country that has a different idea. It's the squid kingdom in the desert region.
